docs.text:
Introduction


Welcome to the docs for 
elections-carousel
: a JavaScript library for a carousel-style presentation of data from a JSON feed of election results.


The 
elections-carousel
 project repository is available at 
https://github.com/hfagerlund/elections-carousel
.




TL;DR


Setting up:


$ git clone https://github.com/hfagerlund/elections-carousel.git
$ npm install
$ http-server
# browse to http://127.0.0.1:8080/elections.html





Adding to a page:


//src of main.js

var ecarousel = new (require(
./elections-carousel
));

ecarousel.init({userURL:'http://127.0.0.1:8080/src/assets/fixtures/results.js', 
                userMainHeadingText: '2011 Election Results'});




Project layout


coverage/          # (Istanbul) code coverage reports
dist/              # production-ready (minified,concatenated,transpiled) files
    css/           # compiled CSS (.css) files
    js/            # compiled JS (.js) files
docs/              # documentation
node_modules/      # **npm** package(s)/files
screenshots/       # screenshots of the **elections-carousel** project
src/               # all project source code
    assets/        # additional project files
        fixtures/  # local version of the sample JSON election results feed
        templates  # (Mustache) template files
    js/            # scripts
        elections/ # elections-carousel scripts (unminified)
        vendors/   # third-party scripts - eg. Google fonts
    sass/          # SASS (.scss) files
test/              # (Tape) test files
docs.title: Intro

docs.text:
Style guide


Naming conventions


Functions, Methods


Camel case starting with lowercase letter. Private method names prefixed with '_' (underscore).


Example - Private method:


function _doSomething(foo) {
    //...
}




Modules


Camel case starting with uppercase letter.


Variables


Camel case starting with lowercase letter.




Linting


Refer to 
.eslintrc
 .


Spacing


2 spaces for indentation. No whitespace at EOL.


Refer to 
.editconfig
 .

docs.text:
Release notes


Links to all release notes are also available at 
https://github.com/hfagerlund/elections-carousel/tags
.




Related reference: 
CHANGELOG






v1.0.0


(Apr 26, 2017)


New Features:




Launched 
project documentation site


New architecture (includes UMD support)


Client-side templating (Mustache)


Added custom script to automate updating of dynamic chunkhash values from (CSS/JS) bundler in demo page


Added .editorconfig


Integrated with Travis


CHANGELOG separated from README




Changed:




Modified build toolchain (added Webpack; removed Grunt, Bower)


Replaced QUnit test harness with TAPE (to support Node as well as browser)


Revised CSS naming conventions


Modified JS linting (replaced JSHint with ESLint)




Fixed:




Accessibility compliance, keyboard support for button controls


Button controls 'jumping' on press/release bug






v0.4.0


(Jan 13, 2016)


New Features:




New look-and-feel (GUI improvements)


switched from horizontal to vertical bars


height of bars provides visualization of percentage of votes per candidate






styling improvements: font updates, gradients, party 'labels' (included in list format), emphasized riding vote totals


(minor) text copy changes




Additional changes:




improved alphabetical ordering of styling rules


updated copyrights


removed unnecessary role attributes


bumped version number


updated README (Changelog, screenshot)






v0.3.0


(Jan 13, 2016)


New Features:




Reordered results: candidates within each riding now listed in descending order by number of votes






v0.2.1


(Dec 14, 2015)


Fixed:




Removed deprecated code






v0.2.0


(Dec 14, 2015)


New features:




Defined global, read-only variables (JSHint strict mode)


Automated package management




Changed:




Refactored code, performance improvements


Improved vote percentages (to 2 decimal places; totals 100%)


Accessibility enhancement: 'Elected' text rendering




Fixed:




Button (enabled/disabled) state bugs






v0.1.1


(Jul 5, 2015)


New features:




Enhanced button states






v0.1.0


(Jul 5, 2015)


New features:




Initial version
docs.title: Release Notes
